element.name: Sweet Hiking by theswerve, Traditional Cache (2.5/3)

long-description.p:
Great Sugar Loaf isn't the highest peak in the Wicklow Mts., being only 501 m high, it is one of the most popular hills . It's the most distinctive mount when looking from Dublin. It has very steep slopes, and many people think it's an extinct volcano, because it really looks like a volcano. But it isn't one, is made of quartzite, which isn't a volcanic rock. In good weather you can see marvellous view.
The best way to get there is from the gap at coordinates N53 08.652 W6 09.305 where you can park your car (or bike). From there it is 30-45 min walk to the summit. Don't forget hiking boots, because this peak is very rocky and it is easy to sprinkle your ankle.
The cache is 1 litre steel container, well-hidden about 60 m from the Sugar Loaf summit. There are some goodies inside and special FTF prize. Watch for Muggles, because it's quite a busy place especially at weekends.

element.encoded-hints: What for the hint? There are only rocks!

ul.li:
2010-05-27T19:00:00Z : Found it by EVILPETE
EVILPETE + MISSUS On holiday from England. What a climb but well worth it Gps was spot on thank goodness. T TB LN TFTC

2010-05-26T19:00:00Z : Found it by Tranicka
Pick up GC, TFTC

2010-05-26T19:00:00Z : Write note by Petr Skacha
TT drop.

2010-05-23T19:00:00Z : Found it by roybrindley
Fantastic location. Dropped off Geocoin.

2010-05-18T19:00:00Z : Found it by Windsockers
Easy find TfTc

In good weather you can see marvellous view.
